<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/previewing-highstakes-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Summer, We Hardly Knew Ye
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The beach " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODUyL3RoZV9iZWFjaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things have never been so quiet and so busy at the same time. Here's what you need to know about the most <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/24/here-comes-one-of-the-newsiest-and-most-critical-weeks-of-the-summer-for-markets.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hectic and high-stakes week</a> we can remember. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Stimulus</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Republicans will unveil their latest stimulus proposal today as a starting point for negotiations. We have a general sense of what it’ll include—funding to help schools reopen, another round of $1,200 stimulus checks, and liability protections for businesses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That expiring $600/week in extra unemployment benefits probably won’t be there...at least in full. The White House <a href="https://www.axios.com/mnuchin-unemployment-benefits-wages-190eae55-6fce-43dd-8507-45a8f88b70b2.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supports</a> capping supplemental unemployment income at 70% of workers’ lost wages.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Earnings</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now’s not the time to get sick of hearing about corporate earnings, because this week is the <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/big-techs-big-test-arrives-in-the-busiest-week-of-earnings-season-2020-07-26?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">busiest yet</a>. Everyone from Apple to McDonald’s to Comcast to GM will share their financial results for the previous quarter. Expect to hear lots of synonyms for "unprecedented." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But at least they’ll have a low bar to clear. The S&P is on track for its worst quarter of earnings growth since 2008.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big Tech antitrust hearings</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/23/brews-guide-big-tech-antitrust-hearings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blockbuster event of the summer</a> starring Amazon’s Jeff Bezos, Google’s Sundar Pichai, Apple’s Tim Cook, and Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg will now <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/zuckerberg-bezos-cook-and-pichai-antitrust-hearing-rescheduled-for-wednesday/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take place</a> on Wednesday. The CEOs of these companies, which along with Microsoft account for more than 20% of the S&P 500, will defend their records against lawmakers and smaller companies who say they’ve unfairly used their market dominance to squash competition. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Fed meeting</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the Federal Reserve held its last meeting six weeks ago, things were bad but appeared somewhat stable. Now, with a renewed outbreak and a stall in the recovery, things are bad and appear <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-26/fed-to-debate-dimming-outlook-as-virus-surges-fiscal-help-hangs?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">somewhat unstable</a>. Chair Jerome Powell is expected to emphasize he’ll keep interest rates near zero for the foreseeable future to juice the collapsed economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How collapsed? We’ll find out on Thursday with the first reading of Q2 GDP numbers. Economists estimate that GDP fell around 35% last quarter.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Everyone’s a day trader now,” <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/everyones-a-day-trader-now-11595649609?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the WSJ</a>. And it’s hard to disagree—in March alone, the trading platform E-Trade recorded more new accounts than any full year in its history.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rival app Robinhood reported 3 million new accounts in Q1, also a record.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Individuals now account for 20% of all stock market activity, the head of execution services at Citadel Securities told the Journal. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what are individuals buying? </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Ford<br>2. GE<br>3. American Airlines<br>4. Disney<br>5. Delta Air Lines<br>6. Apple<br>7. Microsoft<br>8. Tesla<br>9. Carnival <br>10. GoPro</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can find all that info and more at <a href="https://robintrack.net/leaderboard?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Robintrack</a>.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/latest-coronavirus-updates-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
COVID-19 Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not just the U.S. struggling to stamp out the coronavirus. Nearly 40 countries reported <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-global-cases/record-numbers-of-coronavirus-cases-in-every-global-region-reuters-tally-idUSKCN24Q08E?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record single-day bumps</a> in cases over the past week, per Reuters. Here's the latest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spain: </strong>As new hotspots crop up, the government instituted <a href="https://apnews.com/0e10423d8a4453e746428638338d02a1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new restrictions</a> on nightlife in Barcelona and neighboring areas. The UK also made the surprise move of putting Spain on its “unsafe” travel list, meaning that travelers coming back from Spain must self-quarantine for 14 days. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">North Korea: </strong>A city near the border with South Korea has been <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/07/26/895473629/north-korea-reports-1st-suspected-case-of-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">placed under lockdown</a> after someone was found with coronavirus symptoms. It <em>would </em>be North Korea’s first confirmed case, but few experts actually believe that. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">United States: </strong>Florida <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/25/florida-now-has-more-coronavirus-cases-than-new-york-and-california-leads-the-nation.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed</a> New York in confirmed cases following the major outbreak over the past few weeks (California is No. 1). The good news is that upward trend seems to be reversing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Germany and Taiwan: </strong><a href="https://apnews.com/e9878e281e71d58a6bd4e7f88a24797d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Both</a> <a href="https://www.metro.us/set-sail-and-social/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">countries</a> sent cruise ships sailing for the first time since the lockdowns began. Germany’s ship had 1,200 passengers compared to the typical 2,900.</p>

RETAIL

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/2020-retail-bankruptcies-top-2019s-total?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
2020's Biggest Gathering Is Retail Bankruptcies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More retailers have filed for bankruptcy so far this year than in all of 2019, Retail Brew’s Halie LeSavage <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/07/24/ascena-retail-groups-bankruptcy-retail-crosses-grim-milestone?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The latest? Ascena Retail Group, parent to Ann Taylor and Lane Bryant, <a href="https://apnews.com/773b01b61bef0fb3957dc11100bac445?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> for Chapter 11 bankruptcy last week. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ascena will close 1,600 of its 2,800 stores, including all locations of its plus-size label Catherines. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This one's especially going to hurt malls. Ascena is one of the biggest tenants at mall owners Brookfield, Simon, CBL, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/ann-taylor-parents-bankruptcy-is-the-scariest-yet/2020/07/23/6a8b27ae-cce9-11ea-99b0-8426e26d203b_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">and more</a></span><span>.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The list of other retailers filing for bankruptcy in July <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/25/business/july-bankruptcies-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">include</a> Brooks Brothers, Lucky Brand, Muji, Sur La Table, and major Pizza Hut/Wendy’s franchisee NPC International. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s a chart to-go.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODMzL3JldGFpbF9iYW5rcnVwdGNpZXNfc2luY2VfMjAwNy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Francis Scialabba</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more retail news like this: </strong><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=inline&utm_campaign=link&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up for Retail Brew</a>. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CIVIL RIGHTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/john-lewis-crosses-edmund-pettus-bridge-one-final-time?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
'The Final Crossing'
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="John Lewis crosses the bridge in Selma, AL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODU0L2pvaG5fbGV3aXNfY3Jvc3Nlc190aGVfYnJpZGdlX2luX3NlbG1hX2FsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The body of late Rep. John Lewis, an American hero and civil rights icon, is carried across the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, AL, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/26/john-lewis-civil-rights-giant-crosses-infamous-selma-bridge-one-final-time.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one final time</a> yesterday. In 1965, Lewis led a voting rights march of nonviolent protestors across this same bridge, before he and others were beaten by police.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There is currently a <a href="https://apnews.com/f92608d82b01ae0adfaf8515efd833aa?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debate</a> over renaming the bridge. Edmund Pettus was a Confederate officer and KKK leader. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This 5G prediction has us ditching our tin foil hats</strong>. <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/rb-5g-buy-alert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5g-buyalert&aid=9297&paid=9297&waid=9297&source=erbmnbwdg0210008&psource=erbmnbwdg0210008&wsource=erbmnbwdg0210008" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool’s</a> been monitoring this new tech for a while now, and they just issued a buy alert for a 5G stock that’s putting out some serious positive signals. <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/rb-5g-buy-alert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5g-buyalert&aid=9297&paid=9297&waid=9297&source=erbmnbwdg0210008&psource=erbmnbwdg0210008&wsource=erbmnbwdg0210008" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up to learn more</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thanks for the memories, Regis: </strong>For many nights we sat around the TV with our families and watched <em>Who Wants to Be a Millionaire</em>, dreaming not only of becoming extremely wealthy but as smooth and likable as host Regis Philbin, who died this weekend at 88. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>On Mondays, we'll present some of the thorniest business topics of the day, give you a jumping-off point, and encourage you to debate it with friends, family, and coworkers. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today’s topic: </strong>Last week, former presidential candidate Andrew Yang came on our <em>Business Casual </em>podcast to chat with Kinsey about his <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/andrew-yang-is-literally-trying-to-give-you-money/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Data Dividend Project</a>, which wants to help you get paid when companies use and profit off your data. Will a data dividend actually help...or leave surveillance capitalism unchecked? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Here are some of the ways to calculate the value of your data. (</span><span><a href="https://qz.com/1655610/how-can-you-measure-the-worth-of-your-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quartz</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Many Americans feel confused and helpless about data collection. (</span><span><a href="https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/2019/11/15/americans-and-privacy-concerned-confused-and-feeling-lack-of-control-over-their-personal-information/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pew</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Even Facebook’s cofounder supports a data dividend. (</span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/apr/27/chris-hughes-facebook-google-data-tax-regulation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chris Hughes</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Data brokers are quietly buying and selling your info. (</span><span><a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90310803/here-are-the-data-brokers-quietly-buying-and-selling-your-personal-information?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fast Company</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Does paying internet users $100 really address the problem at hand? (</span><span><a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/935358/andrew-yangs-data-dividend-isnt-radical-its-useless?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motherboard</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The limits of viewing information as property (</span><span><a href="https://www.brookings.edu/blog/techtank/2019/06/26/why-data-ownership-is-the-wrong-approach-to-protecting-privacy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brookings</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Ye\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"The beach \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eLos Angeles Times via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThings have never been so quiet and so busy at the same time. Here's what you need to know about the most \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/24/here-comes-one-of-the-newsiest-and-most-critical-weeks-of-the-summer-for-markets.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehectic and high-stakes week\u003c/a\u003e we can remember. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eStimulus\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRepublicans will unveil their latest stimulus proposal today as a starting point for negotiations. We have a general sense of what it’ll include—funding to help schools reopen, another round of $1,200 stimulus checks, and liability protections for businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat expiring $600/week in extra unemployment benefits probably won’t be there...at least in full. The White House \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/mnuchin-unemployment-benefits-wages-190eae55-6fce-43dd-8507-45a8f88b70b2.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupports\u003c/a\u003e capping supplemental unemployment income at 70% of workers’ lost wages.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eEarnings\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow’s not the time to get sick of hearing about corporate earnings, because this week is the \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/big-techs-big-test-arrives-in-the-busiest-week-of-earnings-season-2020-07-26?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebusiest yet\u003c/a\u003e. Everyone from Apple to McDonald’s to Comcast to GM will share their financial results for the previous quarter. Expect to hear lots of synonyms for \"unprecedented.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut at least they’ll have a low bar to clear. The S\u0026P is on track for its worst quarter of earnings growth since 2008.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig Tech antitrust hearings\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/23/brews-guide-big-tech-antitrust-hearings?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblockbuster event of the summer\u003c/a\u003e starring Amazon’s Jeff Bezos, Google’s Sundar Pichai, Apple’s Tim Cook, and Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg will now \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/zuckerberg-bezos-cook-and-pichai-antitrust-hearing-rescheduled-for-wednesday/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake place\u003c/a\u003e on Wednesday. The CEOs of these companies, which along with Microsoft account for more than 20% of the S\u0026P 500, will defend their records against lawmakers and smaller companies who say they’ve unfairly used their market dominance to squash competition. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFed meeting\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen the Federal Reserve held its last meeting six weeks ago, things were bad but appeared somewhat stable. Now, with a renewed outbreak and a stall in the recovery, things are bad and appear \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-26/fed-to-debate-dimming-outlook-as-virus-surges-fiscal-help-hangs?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esomewhat unstable\u003c/a\u003e. Chair Jerome Powell is expected to emphasize he’ll keep interest rates near zero for the foreseeable future to juice the collapsed economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow collapsed? We’ll find out on Thursday with the first reading of Q2 GDP numbers. Economists estimate that GDP fell around 35% last quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not just the U.S. struggling to stamp out the coronavirus. Nearly 40 countries reported \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-global-cases/record-numbers-of-coronavirus-cases-in-every-global-region-reuters-tally-idUSKCN24Q08E?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord single-day bumps\u003c/a\u003e in cases over the past week, per Reuters. Here's the latest.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpain: \u003c/strong\u003eAs new hotspots crop up, the government instituted \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/0e10423d8a4453e746428638338d02a1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew restrictions\u003c/a\u003e on nightlife in Barcelona and neighboring areas. The UK also made the surprise move of putting Spain on its “unsafe” travel list, meaning that travelers coming back from Spain must self-quarantine for 14 days. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNorth Korea: \u003c/strong\u003eA city near the border with South Korea has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/07/26/895473629/north-korea-reports-1st-suspected-case-of-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplaced under lockdown\u003c/a\u003e after someone was found with coronavirus symptoms. It \u003cem\u003ewould \u003c/em\u003ebe North Korea’s first confirmed case, but few experts actually believe that. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnited States: \u003c/strong\u003eFlorida \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/25/florida-now-has-more-coronavirus-cases-than-new-york-and-california-leads-the-nation.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed\u003c/a\u003e New York in confirmed cases following the major outbreak over the past few weeks (California is No. 1). The good news is that upward trend seems to be reversing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGermany and Taiwan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/e9878e281e71d58a6bd4e7f88a24797d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBoth\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.metro.us/set-sail-and-social/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecountries\u003c/a\u003e sent cruise ships sailing for the first time since the lockdowns began. style=\"color:#000\"\u003eToday’s topic: \u003c/strong\u003eLast week, former presidential candidate Andrew Yang came on our \u003cem\u003eBusiness Casual \u003c/em\u003epodcast to chat with Kinsey
